body:
Hi @rgodbey-rev , thank you for filing this issue and for the very clear repro code! I was able to reproduce this and agree that this behavior has regressed between `1.39.0` and `1.40.0`. I will work with the team to get this resolved.

As a workaround, it seems like using the cursor to click the "submit" button, rather than using the `ctrl+enter` keyboard shortcut, will ensure the expected values are submitted.

issue.title: Add shared hooks for submitForm & inputChange

repository.name: streamlit
repository.description: Streamlit ‚Äî A faster way to build and share data apps.

issue.body:
## Describe your changes

Closes #9841

Create shared hooks for submitting forms via enter (+ command key) and for handling onInputChange. These hooks can be used by the `TextInput` and the `TextArea` components (and potentially others?) so that their behavior is exactly the same and we can more easily have unit tests for the desired behavior.
The two hooks are:
- `useSubmitFormViaEnterKey`
- `useOnInputChange`

## GitHub Issue Link (if applicable)

## Testing Plan

- Explanation of why no additional tests are needed
- Unit Tests (JS and/or Python)
  - Add unit tests for the two new hooks which gives us confidence about their behavior for all components that use the hooks
- E2E Tests
  - Add e2e test for `st.text_area` & `st.text_input` which are in forms and submitted via Enter (+ Control) 
- Any manual testing needed?

issue.title: text_area inside form: value does not propagate on Ctrl-Enter

repository.name: streamlit
repository.description: Streamlit ‚Äî A faster way to build and share data apps.

issue.body:
### Checklist

- [X] I have searched the [existing issues](https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/issues) for similar issues.
- [X] I added a very descriptive title to this issue.
- [X] I have provided sufficient information below to help reproduce this issue.

### Summary

Inside a form the text_area's value is not updated correctly when the submitting the value with the keybinding Ctrl+Enter. It's always one update "behind". When unfocusing the the text_area and submitting via the button the state is updated correctly.

### Reproducible Code Example

```Python
import streamlit as st

with st.form("myform"):
    text_input = st.text_input("enter text here", key="text_input")
    text_area = st.text_area("enter text here", key="text_area")

    submit = st.form_submit_button("submit")

    if submit:
        st.write("text_input", text_input)
        st.write("state text_input", st.session_state["text_input"])
        st.write("text_area", text_area)
        st.write("state text_area", st.session_state["text_area"])
```


### Steps To Reproduce

1. focus text_area
2. enter text "test"
3. submit with Ctrl+Enter
4. value is ""
5.

_No response_

- [ ] Yes, this used to work in a previous version.
